page.title: 10FARMING IN EYKE PARISH
page.content:
The soil of the area is generally sandy and the crops grown are: sugar beet, barley, wheat, carrots, oil seed rape since 1982, and potatoes. Apples and blackcurrants are also grown.
Extensive irrigation with huge machines pumping water from the farmer's own reservoir is necessary to produce crops counteract "dust-blow", a problem exacerbated by the removal of hedges in recent years. In some cases these are now being replanted.
Pigs are intensively reared in modern units at the Rookery Farm. Red deer are also found in the area. There were 8 in 1983, and they now number 36.
